text.name: info1
text.text: LaserDisc arcade games use pre-recorded video, either in

text.name: info2
text.text: combination with overlaid sprites or simply as sections of

text.name: info3
text.text: video controllable by the player. The first major LaserDisc

text.name: info4
text.text: game was Sega's Astron Belt, released in 1983. It was closely

text.name: info5
text.text: followed by Dragon's Lair the same year, which is doubtlessly

text.name: info6
text.text: the most famous LaserDisc game. A number of releases followed

text.name: info7
text.text: and to this day there is a community making similar homebrew

text.name: info8
text.text: games, although they no longer technically run on LaserDiscs.
